85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:19): how do i configure dhcp on a solaris box remotely?
b56bf5094b07e2a2cd25e1aff227dc53 (15:19): ssh in, dhcpconfig
b56bf5094b07e2a2cd25e1aff227dc53 (15:19): man dhcp
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:19): spity, what arguments?? i hv created the server but how do i now add ip addresses?
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:20): can anyone tell me what does the < /dev/console signify in /etc/inittab ?
b56bf5094b07e2a2cd25e1aff227dc53 (15:20): sidd: read the manpage
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:21): i have done "dhcpconfig -D -r SUNWfiles -p /usr/local". beyond that, the man pages do not help.
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:21): i understand the rest , couldn't figure our the < /dev/cosole" part
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:22): why and what are we reading (redirecting in) from the console while initialization
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:23): T1GER, not there in my machine. what is the full line? or are there a few lines above that that lead to it?

85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:24): spity, all documents point to the gui. hv no gui. pntadm gives error saying the server address is incorrect, while dhcpconfig -N took the same address and worked.
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:25): in /etc/inittab on pre Solaris 10 - all rc scripts have a trailing " >/dev/msglog 2<> /dev/msglog < /dev/console"
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:26): "/sbin/rcS > /dev/msglog 2 <> /dev/msglog " piece i understand .. write output to msglog .. and error to msglog
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:26): why the < /dev/console at the end ?
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:27): T1GER, maybe this helps - http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=log&m=100327801309834&w=2
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:28): the <> before /dev/msglog says redirect std error to /dev/msglog. what does the < signify?
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:30): exactly what i am looking for ..
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:30): what are we redirecting in with <

85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:32): T1GER, maybe, what it says is that if the program has an internal routine to print error messages to the console, these are redirected  back to the /dev/msglog
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:33): hmm maybe you are right .. if something inside the rc scripts writes out to /dev/console directly then this would again redirect it back here.
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:35): np. i gotta learn too ;)
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:41): how do i add ip addresses to my dhcp server config using cli?

13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:42): nah .. thats now it i guess .. i checked with writing two scripts and nesting one in another .. the script nested inside writes directly to /dev/console and this redirection scheme does not capture it
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:43): T1GER, when you are in bash or sh, does /dev/console point to your current tty?
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:44): i am running the script from the system console .. so guess it does
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:44): do yout test again and  forward something to /dev/console. I suspect it will not show up.

85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:46): ok, so you _are_ working on the console.
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:46): i added a simple echo "console" > /dev/console  and it shows up
85ea10fd16066b9bc85c7b718ac98577 (15:47): now if you write something to console and redirect 1&2 back to another file, what happens?
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:48): it doesn't go to the file.. instead pops up on the console
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (15:48): seems like anything written directly to /dev/console is not redirected.

13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (16:02): before this pntadm piece

13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (16:13): sidd : shouldnt the address following -A be the client ip address ?
13f91026d6580f11471582c267f99a08 (16:16): pntadm -C 192.168.0.0 actually ... since that would your network.
